* BrightBlade glared towards Rex and firearm as they aimed their weapons 
towards her, then watching Grimmler as he walked over to her.
She hated them all but she wasn�t about to freak out at them all, the 
weapons they were holding telling her that it wouldn�t be smart to be that 
stupid.
With a growl she squirmed away from them and the blinding light of the door 
way, looking towards the vent but knowing that she had no hope in Hell of 
reaching it before she was shot.
Her chest was already bleeding heavily and her knees were so sore, feeling 
almost as if she could fall apart right there.
BrightBlade watched silently as Grimmler started walking towards her, the 
cold water making her teeth chatter and her body tremor with shivers.
Her fur was plastered to her body along with mech-fluid matted into it, the 
very picture of damage if there ever was one.
Grimmler grabbed at her left arm but even as he took hold of it she yanked 
it from his grasp, a yip of pain and dismay sounding from her throat. *

� No! Leave me alone!!�

* With that she sank away from him and scurried over to the nearest corner, 
leaving a trail of fluid in her wake.
BrightBlade came to the corner and turned towards the three Maximals again, 
giving them a wide eyes look as well as one of slight fear. Perhaps she 
could play their compassion towards her benefit.
She pressed her back against the corner as hard as she could, giving the 
impression that she was afraid of them to the point that she didn�t want to 
be near them.
Through the corner of her eye she saw Smokescreen poke his head into the 
room, snapping her head towards him in mock surprise and then turning her 
expression from surprise to pleading.
Her shivering got worse but that was not fake, her temp dropping fact.
She looked towards Smokescreen with wide and pleading eyes, but not making 
it obvious that she was faking every bit of it.
She made a small reach towards him with a quick glance towards the other 
three Maximals to appear like she was truly afraid of them. Then looking 
back towards Smokescreen, her voice a sob.*

� Please�don�t let them hurt me anymore.�

* She cupped her hand to her chest and found it soaked with fluid before she 
even knew it, making her seem as if she was as timid as a child and just as 
afraid. Moving towards Smokescreen slightly with a small whimper, and 
actually mustering a few tears to fall down her cheeks as she reached out to 
him again. Shaking and shivering, fluid covered and scared.
She would play the Maximals compassion for all it was worth, and if she 
didn�t seem completely helpless now then she didn�t know what was.
But it was all an act, besides the wounds and the shivering.
Though, it was impossible to know the difference.*
